page.para: My name is Lana. I’m an architect. I’m designing a house for my baby brother and me.
I've looked at homes all over the world.
In some places, people have homes like tents. They fold them up when they want to move.
Some people live in bamboo huts. In some places, the huts are on stilts.
In some cold places, people live in igloos made of snow.
Those houses suit the places and the people. My house will suit my brother and me. I’ve drawn the plans for it.
Now I can start building! But first I must get the space ready. I’ll need this table.
Next, I gather my materials. Houses are made from what people find around them. My house will be the same.
Some houses are built up high, so wild animals can’t get in. It makes the people who live there feel safe.
I’m building my house up high as well. We’ll be safe and cosy up here!
A house needs to be strong. We don’t want it to fall over or blow away.
I’m tying my house down with rope.
Now the walls are on! My house is nearly finished. I can’t wait to go inside, but there’s just one more thing we need.
Look! I’ve built a beautiful castle for my brother and me!
A house also needs a family. My brother and I play in our house all day long.
Now our house is our home.
